alert.note: Alert for Deltana and Tanana Flats; Middle Tanana Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 01 at 4:15PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM AKDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The Salcha River. * WHEN...Until 400 PM AKDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Erosion of the river bank will occur. Trees and other debris will come down the river. Gravel bars will be under water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 352 PM AKDT, Recent heavy rainfall is causing high water and minor flooding on the Salcha River. It is expected that the Salcha River will crest this evening at the Richardson Highway Bridge, and will remain high into the weekend. - For Salcha River near Salchaket: At 3:00pm the stage was 13.45 feet. Forecast: A crest around 13.5 feet is expected around 10:00pm Thursday. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood People along the Salcha River should prepare for minor flooding.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
